meanings.definition: To feel a tingling sensation on the skin
meanings.sent1: As I walked through the tall grass, a gentle breeze prickled my arms.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind prickled my cheeks as I waited for the bus.
meanings.sent3: The tickling sensation prickled my skin, making me giggle.
meanings.sent4: The anticipation of the surprise party prickled my senses like tiny needles.
meanings.sent5: The icy water prickled my feet, sending shivers up my spine.

meanings.definition: To cause a tingling sensation on the skin
meanings.sent1: The spicy food prickled my tongue with its heat.
meanings.sent2: The rough fabric prickled her skin uncomfortably.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected compliment prickled his cheeks with warmth.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence prickled her nerves, making her uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The electric shock prickled his fingers, reminding him to be careful.

meanings.definition: Covered with small, stiff, sharp points
meanings.sent1: The prickled surface of the cactus warned of its sharpness.
meanings.sent2: The prickled texture of the pineapple made it difficult to hold.
meanings.sent3: The prickled hedgehog rolled into a ball for protection.
meanings.sent4: The prickled thorns of the rose bush caught on my sleeve.
meanings.sent5: The prickled leaves of the plant deterred animals from eating them.
